item.title: New ReaSonus version (v0.8.0)
item.description:
A new version of ReaSonus Native has been released.

What's Changed

FaderPort 8/16

This release has a lot of improvements for the UI for Plugin Mapping:

  • Added the option to set the step size in Plugin Control mode on the device. The step size can be set both on-device as in the settings.
  • You can now per control set the invert of the label. This can help you grouping sets of controls.
  • All parameters of the plugin are now in the parameters list.
  • Parameter list is now searchable.
  • Added option to go to a group by number. This way you can go fairly quick to group 100 (or further of course).
  • You can now add a new group at any place and delete any group.
  • Drag and drop has been implemented to change the order of the groups.
  • The limit for the maximum number of groups is set to 1024
  • There is an indicator now that tells per group if it has changed or not.
  • Added option to undo changes per group or all at once
  • Some minor bugs with the UI have been fixed

One more bug has been fixed:

  • The automation buttons were not illuminated correct
During development also an issue was found with not taking the plugin type in account. This can cause issues with the mapping as a VST and VST do not have the same mapping A tool has been created to help you fixing this. In the action list search for plugin type and run it.

FaderPort V2

  • Fixed an issue where the translations for the UI were not loaded

Thanx a lot to DesertEagleDerek for the code contributions and testing

Install

ReaSonus Native is now available in ReaPack. There is no need to add a repository, but works out-of-the-box. In ReaPack search for ReaSonus and you can install it.

Don't forget to install SWS and ReaImGui v0.10 if you have not installed them yet

item.title: Human Made Content
item.description:
While visiting https://www.gearnews.com I ran into a logo they use which states: Human Made Content. As I am not against AI, but also am not a big fan for reasons. I've read the post about why they use this. It in the first paragraph in particular that drew my attention:

More and more content is appearing worldwide that is automatically generated by AI tools and published without final review. We are clearly opposed to this trend: On the one hand, for reputational reasons. On the other, because we are aware that while AI tools have advantages, they also pose a threat to musicians who earn their living through their craft.

How does this apply to ReaSonus? Well, all posts and documentation are written without the use of AI. Probably the grammar and spelling of some of the articles already gave that away.

But what about the code?, I hear you think. Well actually the same. I use, as a test, AI for programming during my daytime job, but beside some autocomplete that comes in handy, I would not let it write more then tests. I'm just not a big fan.

Is there no AI used at all? Yes a bit. As C++ is not my programming mother tongue, and the errors thrown sometimes look like gibberish to me, I use AI to explain the error. That has helped me a couple of times.

When it comes to the logo, I was granted by the owners of Gearnews to use the logo.

item.title: New ReaSonus version (v0.7.0)
item.description:
A new version of ReaSonus Native has been released.

What's Changed

FaderPort 8/16

  • Fixed issue with wrong time code when `Use ruler time unit` was selected.
  • Added the abilty to uninvert labels for the plugin mapping. This is a drop down select on the plugin Mapping page in the ReaSonus Control Panel.
  • Added option to set the scroll size for controlling plugins. This can be set in 3 ways:
    • In the ReaSonus Control panel under the Plugin Control tab
    • In the on-device menu
    • When controlling a plugin, press the Pan/Param encoder. The first display will show the step size. Set the step size with the encoder and click the encoder again to save the value
  • When selecting a track in REAPER and this track is already visible on the FaderPort, it will not change the tracks on the FaderPort. If teh track is not visible on the device, it will scroll with bank-size steps.

Install

ReaSonus Native is now available in ReaPack. There is no need to add a repository, but works out-of-the-box. In ReaPack search for ReaSonus and you can install it.

Don't forget to install SWS and ReaImGui v0.10 if you have not installed them yet

item.title: New ReaSonus version (v0.3.0)
item.description:
A new version of ReaSonus Native has been released.

This version has a new dependency: ReaImGui v0.10.*

What's Changed

All devices

  • Moved the dialogs to ReaImgui. See the documentation for more details.
  • Fixed issue with saw-tooth like envelopes in touch mode

FaderPort 8/16

  • Added pan channel: The pan button now makes the faders handle the pan. Removed the shift + fader behaviour
  • Moved the receives channel to [Shift] + [Send] to make space for the Pan channel
  • Added option to make [Left Shift] + [Fader Touch] reset the fader value. This is a setting and off by default
  • Changed the shift behaviour for all channel related modi (track, plugin, send, etc...). Now when the shift(left or right), this does not reflect on these modi.
  • Fixed issue where all faders right of the last send fader also moved.
  • Added converter for the old zon plugin mapping files (It is always recommanded doing a test run on a portable install)
  • When on-device menu is open, it will now close with any click on the [Touch] button
  • Added option in the settings to change the Display layout in track mode. This also available in the on-device menu

FaderPort V2

  • Fixed bug where fader became inresponsive after adding a new track

Install

ReaSonus Native is now available in ReaPack. There is no need to add a repository, but works out-of-the-box. In ReaPack search for ReaSonus and you can install it.

Don't forget to install SWS and ReaImGui v0.10 if you have not installed them yet
